path: books/Category Theory For Programmers/15. The Yoneda Lemma/2

attr.a: The `C(a, -)` functor must be mapping a into singleton set and every other into empty set. So natural transformation must be looking like singleton set `C(a, a)` selecting an object in `F a` while any other objects are transformed via absurd function.
attr.q: A discrete category is one that has objects but no morphisms other than identity morphisms. How does the Yoneda lemma work for functors from such a category?
